Surface Simplification Using Quadric Error Metrics. Siggraph 1997. Sum of quadrics represents set of planes $$ \sum _i(n_i^TV+d_i)^2=\sum _iQ_i(V)=\begin{pmatrix}\sum _iQ_i \end{pmatrix}(V) $$ Each vertex has an associated quadric â€¢ Error\((v_i) = Q_i (v_i)\) â€¢ Sum quadrics when contracting \((v_i,v_j) \to vâ€™\) â€¢ Cost of contraction is \(Q(vâ€™)\) $$ Q=Q_i+Q_j=(A_i+A_j,b_i+b_j,c_i+c_j) $$ Sum of endpoint quadrics determines vâ€™ â€¢ Fixed placement: select \(v_1\) or \(v_2\) â€¢ Optimal placement: choose vâ€™ minimizing \(Q(vâ€™)\) $$ \nabla Q({V}' )=0\Rightarrow {V}' =-A^{-1}b $$ â€¢ Fixed placement is faster but lower quality â€¢ But it also gives smaller progressive meshes â€¢ Fallback to fixed placement if A is nonâ€invertible
